8 queens problem

Another thing from onon1101

$$Q_{1}=\bigwedge_{i=1}^{n}\bigvee_{j=1}^{n}p(i,j)$$
$$Q_{2}=\bigwedge_{i=1}^{n}\bigwedge_{j=1}^{n-1}\bigvee_{k=j+1}^{n}(\neg p(i,j) \vee \neg p(i,k))$$
$$Q_{3}=\bigwedge_{j=1}^{n}\bigwedge_{i=1}^{n-1}\bigvee_{k=i+1}^{n}(\neg p(i,j) \vee \neg p(k,j))$$
$$Q_{4}=\bigwedge_{i=2}^{n}\bigwedge_{j=1}^{n-1}\bigvee_{k=1}^{min(i-1,n-j)}(\neg p(i,j) \vee \neg p(i-k,k+j))$$
$$Q_{5}=\bigwedge_{i=1}^{n-1}\bigwedge_{j=1}^{n-1}\bigvee_{k=1}^{min(n-i,n-j)}(\neg p(i,j) \vee \neg p(i+k,j+k))$$
